intro: Sanicula canadensis var. marilandica, commonly known as Maryland waterdropwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of wetland ecosystems.
